info.game_comments: (Jimmy: I'm Jimmy on the 18th at Porter Valley Country Club.  A swinging episode of Jeopardy!--next!)

jeopardy_round: TIME FOR A ROUND OF GOLF

(1, 1).clue: I was told this man thinks a mustache makes game show hosts look more intelligent & thoughtful

(2, 1).clue: This enclosure for horses or cattle was usually made of posts or poles; temporary ones were of rope

(3, 1).clue: Obviously feeling no one could replace him, Fillmore never named anyone to this cabinet-level job

(5, 1).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew tees off at the Porter Valley Golf Club.)  The putt I just sank gave me one-over-par on the hole, also called this

(6, 1).clue: There are this many cards in one player's hand in standard draw poker

(1, 2).clue: The hairless miniature Xoloitzcuintli of this North American country wanted to look macho

(2, 2).clue: This cookhouse on wheels was said to have been invented by Charles Goodnight who modified an army wagon

(3, 2).clue: Under Fillmore the price of this dropped from 5 cents to 3; in 2001, it went up from 33 cents to 34

(5, 2).clue: First awarded in 1958, an amateur golf trophy is named for this U.S. president

(6, 2).clue: In an expression possibly from Shakespeare's time, a short-lived sensation is this many "days' wonder"

(1, 3).clue: Rumor has it this woman infiltrated the vast right-wing conspiracy by wearing a clever disguise

(2, 3).clue: Slang term for the cemetery of a western town; Dodge City's dates back to 1872

(3, 3).clue: The Fillmore-approved Compromise of 1850 included admitting this "Golden State" into the Union

(5, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Porter Valley.)  I'm ready to tee off; if my shot curves to the right, it's a slice; if it curves to the left, it's called this

(6, 3).clue: In a 1960 film, this title number of crooks, led by Danny Ocean, plan a Vegas caper

(1, 4).clue: Photos by NASA's Pathfinder revealed the face formation has a new addition on this planet

(2, 4).clue: When riding a wild horse, it was a disgrace to have to "grab the apple" to stay on, the apple being this

(3, 4).clue: Don't flip out if you don't know Fillmore was the last president from this political party

(5, 4).clue: Each year this Georgia city hosts the Masters golf tournament

(6, 4).clue: Number of stars in the Big Dipper

(1, 5).clue: This governor wants to appeal to young punks when he gets back into pro wrestling

(2, 5).clue: Originally applied to a gun named for its inventor, it later became generic for small single-shot pistols

(3, 5).clue: Fillmore died in 1874 & was buried in this city in New York state, later the site of McKinley's assassination

(5, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Porter Valley.)  Though technically illegal, the retaking of a lousy shot is known by this last name

(6, 5).clue: The traditional number of those who attended the Last Supper

(1, 1).clue: In 1975 H&G featured a futuristic house with mylar panels for this type of electric power

(2, 1).clue: In 1993 this "SNL" alum returned to TV as a late-night talk show host, but lasted only 6 weeks

(4, 1).clue: Though he was only a TV doctor, in 1979 he received an honorary M.D. from Columbia's medical school

(5, 1).clue: Joseph Haydn was a choirboy at St. Stephen's until this happened to him & he was cut adrift in Vienna

(6, 1).clue: One of the 5 K's of Sikh belief, Kesh is the vow never to cut this

(1, 2).clue: Early in H&G history, a regular feature was this season's planting number, as seen here

(2, 2).clue: Protests by gay rights groups cost this radio "doctor" sponsors for her TV show

(4, 2).clue: This magic word is the title of a No, 1 hit by the Steve Miller Band

(5, 2).clue: The tick-tock rhythm in the symphony heard here led to this nickname

(1, 3).clue: Suburban decade during which H&G ran the cover seen here

(2, 3).clue: Teens & critics protested when ABC dropped this low-rated Claire Danes series midseason

(4, 3).clue: It's the fear of open spaces

(5, 3).clue: The symphony known as La Poule or "The Hen" is one of the 6 named for this capital city

(6, 3).clue: Her assassination in 1984 was in retaliation for an attack she ordered on the Sikhs' holiest shrine

(1, 4).clue: In December 1956 this film director might have saved readers by showing how to carve a Christmas turkey

(2, 4).clue: In 1989 housewife Terry Rakolta tried to get advertisers & viewers to boycott this Fox sitcom

(4, 4).clue: The walls around this Spanish city were 400 years old when St. Teresa lived there

(5, 4).clue: This composer dedicated a set of 6 quartets to Haydn, who was 24 years his senior

(6, 4).clue: Now a term for any spiritual guide, this term was first applied to Nanak, the founder of the Sikh faith

(1, 5).clue: A 1949 issue showed the very modern home of this architect & Bauhaus founder

(2, 5).clue: Religious groups protested this '90s drama in which Kevin Anderson played a priest dealing with sensitive issues

(4, 5).clue: This "stately" Confederate cruiser sank many ships before being sunk by the Kearsarge off the coast of France

(5, 5).clue: In the 1770s even the mellow Haydn was influenced by this movement whose name means "storm & stress"

(6, 5).clue: In 1966 this Indian state was divided to create a homeland for members of the Sikh faith

(0, 0).clue: In April 2001 Kevin Costner screened his film "Thirteen Days" for this man, a key player in the events portrayed
